p: The discussion above implies that the water molecules have certain ordering in the FHS. This kind of order is also closely related to the local coordination environment of ions. Figure 5 presents the distribution of cos(α) and cos(γ) in the FHS for Na + (a and b) and Cl – (c and d) in the first layer. The distribution of cos(α) and cos(γ) is similar for type I and type II Na +. The peak of type II Na + at cos(α)=0 is sharper than that of type I, and the distribution of cos(γ) for type II just slightly shifts to the right relative to that of type I. However, coordinating with/without Na + has a significant effect on the orientation of water molecules in the FHS of Cl –. The distribution of both cos(α) and cos(γ) for type I Cl – has more and sharper peaks than those for type II Cl –, which indicates that the water around type I Cl – is more ordered.
